metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6071 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 65.0.3325.146 alloweda remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a craftedHTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6071` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1').
